title: Peri-Peri Chicken with Roasted Green Beans and Spanish Rice

ingredients.name: olive oil or butter (for rice finishing)

directions: Preheat oven to 425Â°F. Toss green beans with olive oil, salt, pepper, garlic powder, and optional chili flakes. Roast for 15-20 minutes, tossing once.
Butterfly the chicken breast, then slice into 1/2-inch strips across the grain. Season with salt, black pepper, garlic powder, smoked paprika, and optional cumin.
Heat skillet over medium-high with avocado or olive oil. Add chicken in a single layer without crowding. Cook about 3 minutes per side until lightly browned.
Kill the heat, then toss chicken with 2-3 tbsp peri-peri sauce. Rest for 2 minutes.
Cook the Knorr Spanish Rice according to package directions. When done, fluff and stir in 0.5-1 tbsp olive oil or butter. Optionally add a tiny squeeze of peri-peri or a pinch of smoked paprika.
Optionally finish green beans with a light drizzle of peri-peri.
Slice or cube the avocado and season with salt (and lime/lemon juice if available).
Plate: Rice base, chicken on top, green beans alongside, avocado on top, and a zig-zag drizzle of sriracha mayo to finish.
notes: Spanish rice fits better than white rice here because the tomato and pepper base matches the peri-peri heat. White rice would be too neutral. Skip BBQ sauce for this dish as it clashes with the Spanish rice. Peri-peri is the primary sauce, sriracha mayo provides the creamy contrast. Avocado goes on top fresh (not cooked).
